name: rnavar-variant-calling
title: RNA Variant Calling (nf-core/rnavar)
description: Identify genetic variants from RNA-seq data following GATK4 best practices. Detects SNPs and indels in transcribed regions for disease gene discovery and allele-specific expression analysis. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,strandedness`
content:
RNA Variant Calling

The nf-core/rnavar pipeline identifies genetic variants (SNPs and indels) from RNA-seq data using GATK4 best practices optimized for RNA sequencing.

Scientific Applications

  • Disease Gene Discovery: Identify pathogenic variants in expressed genes
  • Allele-Specific Expression: Quantify imbalanced allele expression
  • RNA Editing: Detect A-to-I and other RNA editing events
  • Cancer Genomics: Identify tumor-specific mutations from RNA
  • Rare Disease: Variant detection in hard-to-sequence genes
  • Pharmacogenomics: Identify variants affecting drug response

Pipeline Features

  • STAR Alignment: Splice-aware read mapping
  • GATK4 Best Practices: SplitNCigarReads, BaseRecalibration, HaplotypeCaller
  • Variant Annotation: snpEff and Ensembl VEP functional annotation
  • UMI Support: Optional unique molecular identifier processing
  • Quality Control: FastQC, RSeQC, MultiQC comprehensive reports
  • Duplicate Marking: Picard MarkDuplicates

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet:

  • sample: Sample identifier
  • fastq_1: Forward reads
  • fastq_2: Reverse reads (if paired-end)

Key Outputs

  • VCF Files: Called variants per sample
  • Annotated Variants: Functional predictions and effects
  • BAM Files: Aligned reads for visualization
  • QC Reports: MultiQC summary of all metrics

Perfect for: Cancer researchers • Clinical genomics • Rare disease • RNA editing • Allele-specific expression
